basics.name: Noah Farr
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: A computer science student with experience in reinforcement learning and software engineering, currently pursuing a bachelor's degree at TU Darmstadt.

work.name: TNO-ESI
highlights: Evaluate the potential of reinforcement learning algorithms in intelligent diagnostics
Conduct experiments to apply reinforcement learning for root cause analysis

work.name: C24 Bank
highlights: Tested new features for acceptance and managed weekly releases

projects.name: Reinforcement Learning for Contact-Rich Manipulation
projects.summary: Developed a novel approach for contact-rich manipulation tasks, validated using IsaacSim and MuJoCo.
highlights: Conducted a literature review on reinforcement learning issues
Validated novel approach for robotic manipulation tasks

projects.name: On Designing Reward Functions for Robotic Tasks
projects.summary: Bachelor thesis on novel reward function design for robotics, validated using MuJoCo.
highlights: Developed and tested custom locomotion and manipulation tasks
